Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: The cell membrane is a layer around the outside of the cell.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: It (cell membrane) gives the cell shape.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: The cell membrane controls what materials move into and out of the cell.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: The cell membrane is filled with a gel-like liquid called cytoplasm.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: Cytoplasm is made mostly of water.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: A variety of organelles float in the cytoplasm.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: The cytoplasm supports all the cell’s structures.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: It is constantly moving through the cell in a stream-like motion.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: One organelle in the animal cell is the nucleus,

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: The cell’s control center (nucleus)

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: It (nucleus) is a large, round organelle

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: Usually found in the center of the cell (nucleus)

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: It (nucleus) has a membrane with pores, or openings, that allow certain materials to pass in and out.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: It (nucleus) sends signals to all other parts of the cell.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: These functions (grow, move, divide) are controlled by a cell’s nucleus.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: Mitochondria are also found in the animal cell.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: They (mitochondria) are oval, membrane-covered organelles

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: That supply energy for the cell

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: Each mitochondrion is a tiny power plant.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: They (mitochondria) break down food

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: Which releases energy for the cell

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: Vacuoles, membrane-covered structures

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: (vacuoles) used for storage

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: It (vacuole) can store water, food, and wastes.

Title: Animal Cells
Idea Unit: The nucleus can signal a vacuole to release whatever it is storing.
